SEARCH
Package InfluencerSystem

Class Main

java.lang.Object
InfluencerSystem.Main
public class Main extends Object
The main entry point for the Influencer Platform application.

The Main class handles user authentication, manages user sessions, and provides dashboards for different user types including influencers, brand managers, and admins. It also initializes sample data for testing purposes.

    • handleUserSession

      private static void handleUserSession(User user, BufferedReader reader) throws Exception
      Handles the user session after successful login.
      Parameters:
      user - The logged-in user.
      reader - The BufferedReader for user input.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during session handling.

    • logoutPrompt

      private static boolean logoutPrompt(BufferedReader reader) throws IOException
      Prompts the user with logout options and handles the user's choice.
      Parameters:
      reader - BufferedReader to read user input.
      Returns:
      true if the user chooses to log out and log in as a different user; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • influencerDashboard

      private static boolean influencerDashboard(Influencer influencer, BufferedReader reader) throws Exception
      Displays the influencer dashboard and handles user choices.
      Parameters:
      influencer - The influencer currently logged in.
      reader - BufferedReader to read user input.
      Returns:
      true if the user chooses to stay logged in; false if the user chooses to log out.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the operation.

    • findInfluencer

      private static Influencer findInfluencer(String username)
      Finds an influencer by username.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the influencer to find.
      Returns:
      The influencer object if found; null otherwise.

    • getPlatform

      private static Platform getPlatform(int choice)
      Retrieves the appropriate Platform instance based on the user's choice. This method maps the user's choice to a specific platform type. If the choice is 1, it returns an instance of YouTube. If the choice is 2, it returns an instance of Instagram. If the choice is 3, it returns an instance of Twitter. For any other choice, it defaults to returning an instance of YouTube.
      Parameters:
      choice - An integer representing the user's choice of platform.
      Returns:
      A Platform instance corresponding to the user's choice.

    • getPassword

      private static String getPassword(BufferedReader reader) throws IOException
      Prompts the user to enter a password and retrieves it securely. This method checks if a console is available for secure password input. If a console is available, it uses it to read the password without echoing it. If no console is available, it prompts the user to enter the password normally, which may echo the input.
      Parameters:
      reader - BufferedReader to read user input if no console is available.
      Returns:
      The password entered by the user as a String.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the input.
